Miami_Beach.NAP of the Americas:
Network Access Point (NAP) of the Americas (also called MI1) is a massive, six-story, 750,000 square foot data center and Internet exchange point in Miami, Florida, operated by Equinix.
The facility is home to 160 network carriers and is a pathway for data traffic from the Caribbean and South and Central America to more than 148 countries.
The NAP of the Americas is built 32 feet above sea level and is designed to withstand Category 5 hurricane-level winds.
